2026-02-11.content:
For Exadata Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports the following regions and zones:

* `australia-southeast2-a-r2` (Melbourne, Australia)
* `asia-south2-b-r1` (Delhi, India)

For a list of supported locations, see [Supported regions and zones](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud Expands Region Support
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports additional regions in Melbourne, Australia, and Delhi, India. This expansion enhances global accessibility and performance for your Oracle databases on Google Cloud infrastructure. For a comprehensive list of supported locations, please refer to the official documentation.

2026-02-04.content:
For Exadata Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports the `asia-northeast2` (Osaka, Japan) region.

For a list of supported locations, see [Supported regions and zones](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud expands to Osaka
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports the Osaka region (asia-northeast2) for Exadata Database Service. This expansion provides customers in Japan with enhanced access to Oracle's high-performance database solutions within Google Cloud's infrastructure.

2025-12-18.content:
Oracle Database@Google Cloud adds the following regions and zones for its services:

* Exadata Database Service on Exascale infrastructure

  + `northamerica-northeast1-a-r1` (Montréal, Québec, Canada)
  + `us-east4-a-r2` (Northern Virginia, North America)
* Base Database Service

  + `northamerica-northeast1-a-r1` (Montréal, Québec, Canada)
  + `us-east4-a-r2` (Northern Virginia, North America)

For a full list of supported locations, see [Supported regions and zones](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud expands regions
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud has added new regions and zones for its Exadata and Base Database services, including locations in Montréal, Canada, and Northern Virginia, North America. This expansion enhances service availability and accessibility for customers.

2025-12-10.content:
For Base Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports the `us-central1` (Iowa, North America) region.

For a list of supported locations, see [Supported regions and zones](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud Now Available in Iowa
summary.summary: The Oracle Database@Google Cloud service now supports the us-central1 region in North America. This expansion allows users to deploy Oracle databases within Google Cloud's infrastructure in this key location. For a complete list of supported regions, please refer to the official documentation.

2025-12-09.content: For Autonomous Databases, you can perform restore operation through Google Cloud console. This feature is [Generally Available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Restore operation for Autonomous Databases
summary.summary: You can now restore your Autonomous Databases using the Google Cloud console. This feature is Generally Available.

2025-12-08.content:
Oracle Database@Google Cloud adds the following regions and zones for its services:

* Exadata Database Service

  + `southamerica-east1` (São Paulo, Brazil, South America)
* Autonomous Database Service

  + `australia-southeast1` (Sydney, Australia)
  + `asia-south1` (Mumbai, India)
  + `southamerica-east1` (São Paulo, Brazil, South America)

For a full list of supported locations, see [Supported regions and zones](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: New Oracle Database@Google Cloud regions
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud is now available in new regions, including São Paulo, Brazil; Sydney, Australia; and Mumbai, India, for Exadata Database Service and Autonomous Database Service.

2025-11-18.content:
Oracle Database@Google Cloud adds the following regions and zones for its services:

* Exadata Database Service

  + `australia-southeast1-b-r1` (Sydney, Australia)
  + `northamerica-northeast2-a-r2` (Toronto, Canada)
* Exadata Database Service on Exascale infrastructure

  + `us-central1-a-r1` (Iowa, North America)
  + `us-west3-a-r1` (Salt Lake City, North America)
* Autonomous Database Service

  + `northamerica-northeast2` (Toronto, Canada)

For a full list of supported locations, see [Supported regions and zones](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: New Oracle Database@Google Cloud Locations
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud is now available in new regions, including Sydney, Australia and Toronto, Canada. This expansion includes Exadata Database Service and Autonomous Database Service, offering more options for customers in North America and Australia. For a complete list of locations, please refer to the official documentation.

2025-11-13.content:
For Exadata Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports region `asia-south1` (Mumbai, India).

For a full list of supported locations, see [Regional availability](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/available-configurations#regions).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud Now Available in Mumbai
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports the Exadata Database Service in the `asia-south1` region (Mumbai, India). This expansion allows customers in the region to leverage Oracle

2025-11-10.content:
For Autonomous Databases, you can [perform a failover](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/perform-failover)
in the event of a disaster in which your primary database becomes inaccessible. This
feature is [Generally Available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Failover for Autonomous Databases
summary.summary: A new feature allows you to perform a failover for Autonomous Databases in case of a disaster. This feature is now Generally Available.

2025-10-09.content:
Oracle Database@Google Cloud adds the following regions and zones for its services:

* Exadata Database Service

  + `europe-west2-a-r1` (London, Europe)
  + `europe-west3-a-r2` (Frankfurt, Europe)
* Exadata Database Service on Exascale infrastructure

  + `asia-northeast1-a-r1` (Tokyo, Asia Pacific)
  + `europe-west3-b-r1` (Frankfurt, Europe)
* Base Database Service

  + `asia-northeast1-a-r1` (Tokyo, Asia Pacific)
  + `europe-west3-b-r1` (Frankfurt, Europe)
* Autonomous Database Service

  + `australia-southeast2` (Melbourne, Asia Pacific)
  + `us-central1` (Iowa, North America)

For a full list of supported locations, see [Supported regions and zones](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: New regions available for Oracle Database@Google Cloud
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports more locations across Europe, Asia Pacific, and North America for various services including Exadata and Autonomous Database. Check the documentation for a full list of supported regions and zones.

2025-10-01.content: Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports [customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK)](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/cmek) using Cloud Key Management Service. You can [enable CMEK on Exadata VM Clusters and Autonomous Databases](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/use-cmek). This feature is [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports customer-managed encryption keys
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports customer-managed encryption keys (CMEK) for Exadata VM Clusters and Autonomous Databases using Cloud Key Management Service. This feature is now generally available.

2025-09-29.content:
For Exadata Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports region `australia-southeast2` (Melbourne, Australia).

For a full list of supported locations, see [Regional availability](https://docs.cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/available-configurations#regions)

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports Melbourne, Australia
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports Exadata Database Service in the `australia-southeast2` region (Melbourne, Australia). For a complete list of supported locations, please refer to the regional availability documentation.

2025-09-23.content: Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports Exadata Database Service on Exascale Infrastructure, which lets you [create and manage Exascale VM Clusters and Exascale Storage Vaults](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/create-exascale-clusters). This feature is [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud Now Supports Exadata
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud has introduced support for Exadata Database Service on Exascale Infrastructure. This new feature allows users to create and manage Exascale VM Clusters and Exascale Storage Vaults, and is now generally available.

2025-09-16.content: Oracle Database@Google Cloud introduces zones in existing supported regions. You can select a zone for Exadata Infrastructure instances, VM clusters, ODB Networks, and DB systems while provisioning these resources. This feature is [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages). See [Supported regions and zones](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/regions-and-zones).

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud Now Supports Zones
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now allows you to select specific zones for Exadata Infrastructure, VM clusters, ODB Networks, and DB systems during provisioning. This new feature enhances flexibility and control over your resource deployment within supported regions. It is now generally available.

2025-09-15.content: Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports Oracle Base Database Service, which lets you [create DB systems through Google Cloud Console and Google Cloud API](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/create-base-db-system). This feature is [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages).

summary.title: Oracle Base Database Service Now Available
summary.summary: Oracle Base Database Service is now generally available on Oracle Database@Google Cloud. You can now create DB systems using the Google Cloud Console and API.

2025-09-10.content:
For Autonomous Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports region `northamerica-northeast1` (Montréal, Québec, Canada, North America).

For a full list of supported locations, see [Regional availability](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/available-configurations#regions)

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud Now Available in Montréal
summary.summary: We are excited to announce that Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports the `northamerica-northeast1` region in Montréal, Québec, Canada. This expansion allows customers in North America to leverage Oracle

2025-08-19.content:
For Exadata Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports region `northamerica-northeast1` (Montréal, Québec, Canada, North America).

For a full list of supported locations, see [Regional availability](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/available-configurations#regions)

summary.title: New Region for Exadata
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports Exadata Database Service in Montréal.

2025-08-14.content: Oracle Database@Google Cloud introduces ODB Networks and ODB Subnets, which let you connect your Oracle Database@Google Cloud resources in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) child site with your Google Cloud VPC network. This feature is [generally available (GA)](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages). For information about deployment options, see [Set up Oracle Database@Google Cloud environment](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/setup-oracle-database-environment), and to learn how to create ODB Networks and Subnets, see [Create ODB Networks and ODB Subnets](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/create-odb-network).

summary.title: ODB Networks and ODB Subnets Now GA
summary.summary: Connect Oracle Database@Google Cloud resources with Google Cloud VPC network.

2025-08-04.content:
For Exadata Database Service, Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports region `us-central1` (Iowa, North America).

For a full list of supported locations, see [Regional availability](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/available-configurations#regions)

summary.title: Exadata Database Service Support in us-central1
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports Exadata Database Service in the us-central1 region (Iowa, North America).

2025-06-05.content:
Oracle Database@Google Cloud supports region `asia-northeast1` (Tokyo, Japan).

For a full list of supported locations, see [Regional availability](https://cloud.google.com/oracle/database/docs/available-configurations#regions)

summary.title: Oracle Database@Google Cloud Now Available in Tokyo
summary.summary: Oracle Database@Google Cloud now supports the `asia-northeast1` region in Tokyo, Japan, expanding its global availability. For a comprehensive list of supported locations, please refer to the official documentation on regional availability.
